greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Ultimate modulo 10: right-hand nonzero digit of n.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for sequences related to final digits of numbers
formula: If n mod 10 = 0 then a(n) = a(n/10), otherwise a(n) = n mod 10.
mathematica: um10[n_]:=Module[{idns=Split[IntegerDigits[n]]},If[idns[[-1,1]] == 0, idns[[-2,1]], idns[[-1,1]]]]; Array[um10,110] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Dec 26 2016 *)
program: (PARI) { for (n=1, 1000, a=n; while (a%10 == 0, a\=10); write("b065881.txt", n, " ", a%10) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Nov 03 2009
xref: In base 2 this is A000012, base 3 A060236 and base 4 A065882. For n <= 100 this sequence is also "Remove final zeros from n" which in bases 2, 3 and 4 produces A000265, A038502 and A065883. Cf. A010879.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Nov 26 2001
